intro: Chomelia venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan chomelia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, fragrant white flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface. Chomelia venezuelensis is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
